description.narrative: By 2020, the capacity of the Government at national and decentralized levels in policy development, planning, monitoring, coordination, programme implementation, financial resource leveraging and budgeting for equitable and sustainable access to WASH services at scale improved., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Disaster Risk Reduction, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Public Finance And Local Governance, Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Social Protection, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, people in targeted rural, small towns, and peri-urban areas use sustainable and safe drinking water services, adequate sanitation and improved hygiene practices.

sector.narrative: PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - eliminating open defecation in rural communities
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict
Water sector policy and administrative management
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

Water supply and Sanitation rural sanitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, the capacity of the Government at national and decentralized levels in policy development, planning, monitoring, coordination, programme implementation, financial resource leveraging and budgeting for equitable and sustainable access to WASH services at scale improved.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the GoM to improve the WASH enabling environment through the development of policies, strategies, standards and norms for the WASH sector as well as the improvements to the WASH monitoring system and evidence-generation for the sector. Additionally, UNICEF continued to provide capacity development support at the national level, reaching all provincial government counterparts with targeted training and on-the-job technical support. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: National budget allocated & spent for WASH (as % of annual state budget)
Nationwide Sustainability Compacts or Actions plans are in place
National standards for WASH in schools with a disability component available
National strategy to eliminate open defecation available with a systemic approach to gender
